basic.floral_language:
Plectranthus hadiensis var. tomentosus
Floriography: optimistic, brave, lively 
Plectranthus hadiensis var. tomentosus, as the name implies, one can smell apple fragrance by hand touching. 
The fleshy leaves are ovoid and light green with a layer of white short fluff on the surface. Apple aroma, refreshing. Besides ornamental value, it still can make tea and be edible. 
Plectranthus hadiensis var. tomentosus like the mild sunshine. Avoid direct light, otherwise easy to become yellow. When it is flowering, the flower colors are bright, include red, pink, blue, etc.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, blooms sometimes, red, pink, blue flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green, on the edges with brown dots

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate sunshine, also resistant to half shade, in summer no apparent dormancy
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
